DataElement.preferredName: Substance Extraction Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Duration ISO21090.PQ.TIME.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The completed action of extracting something from an associated study subject for the purpose of the extracted product to be administered to a study subject. EXAMPLE(S): A donor giving Bone Marrow Stem Cells for a Stem Cell Transplant NOTE(S): The study subject could be the same for the extraction and the intended administration. This is different than a performed specimen collection, in that the intent is different: This is a donation. The period of time over which the activity is performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Substance Extraction Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity Duration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.:The act of pulling out, including the process of obtaining something from a mixture or compound by chemical or physical or mechanical means.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions._The period of time during which something continues.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Substance Extraction Intervention or Procedure Performed Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.:The act of pulling out, including the process of obtaining something from a mixture or compound by chemical or physical or mechanical means.:An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Concepts.definition: Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.
The act of pulling out, including the process of obtaining something from a mixture or compound by chemical or physical or mechanical means.

An activity that produces an effect, or that is intended to alter the course of a disease in a patient or population. This is a general term that encompasses the medical, social, behavioral, and environmental acts that can have preventive, therapeutic, or palliative effects.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: The period of time during which something continues.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Constrains PQ to have units that describe a period of time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happened. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.
